docs.summary: Manage Discount Rules.

permissions.name: Manage eCommerce - all permissions
permissions.description: Request permission to read, create and modify the site's Wix eCommerce data, including cart, checkout, and order data. This permission scope contains all of the eCommerce permissions.

docs.summary: Creates a new discount rule.

examples.title: Create Buy X Get Y Discount Rule

extra.description: If the customer purchases a shirt from the shirts category, they'll get a hat from the hats category for free. Discount can be applied up to 2 times (buy 2 hats, get 2 hats).

docs.summary:
Query discount rules using [WQL (Wix Query Language)](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/getting-started/api-query-language).
Total entries (`pagingMetadata.total`) will be returned only for the first page.

> **Note:** `discountRule.status` can't be used for querying.

examples.title: Query Discount Rules

extra.description: Query Discount rules by active and start date fields, sorted by name

permissions.name: Manage eCommerce - all permissions
permissions.description: Request permission to read, create and modify the site's Wix eCommerce data, including cart, checkout, and order data. This permission scope contains all of the eCommerce permissions.

params.name: mask
params.doc: Explicit list of fields to update.

docs.summary:
Updates a discount rule.

Each time the discount rule is updated, `revision` increments by 1. The existing `revision` must be included when updating the discount rule.
This ensures you're working with the latest discount rule information, and it prevents unintended overwrites.
Triggered when a discount rule is created.

members.name: kind
members.doc: The kind of value.

members.name: nullValue
members.doc: Represents a null value.

members.name: numberValue
members.doc: Represents a double value.

members.name: stringValue
members.doc: Represents a string value.

members.name: boolValue
members.doc: Represents a boolean value.

members.name: structValue
members.doc: Represents a structured value.

members.name: listValue
members.doc: Represents a repeated `Value`.

members.name: id
members.doc: Scope ID.

members.name: type
members.doc: Scope type.

members.name: catalogItemFilter
members.doc: Catalog item filter. Must be passed with `type."CATALOG_ITEM"`.

members.name: customFilter
members.doc: Custom filter. Must be passed with `type."CATALOG_ITEM"`.

members.name: catalogAppId
members.doc: Catalog App ID. For example, the Wix Stores, Wix Bookings, or 3rd-party `appId`.

members.name: catalogItemIds
members.doc: ID of the item within its Wix or 3rd-party catalog. For example, `productId` for Wix Stores.

members.name: appId
members.doc: Custom filter app ID, when relevant.

members.name: params
members.doc:
Custom filter in `{ "key": "value" }` form.
 For example, an array of `collectionIDs`:
 `{ ["collectionId": "12345"], ["collectionId": "67890"] }`.

members.name: triggers
members.doc:
List of triggers.
 Max: 5 triggers.

members.name: id
members.doc: Trigger ID.

members.name: appId
members.doc: ID of the app that created the trigger.

members.name: scopes
members.doc: Relevant scopes for `SPECIFIC_ITEMS` target type.

members.name: from
members.doc: Minimum subtotal price (inclusive).

members.name: to
members.doc: Maximum subtotal price (inclusive).

members.name: scopes
members.doc: Relevant scopes for `SPECIFIC_ITEMS` target type.

members.name: from
members.doc: Minimum item quantity (inclusive).

members.name: to
members.doc: Maximum item quantity (inclusive).

members.name: triggerType
members.doc:
Trigger type.

+ `AND`: Operator used for chaining multiple triggers. Currently 1 `AND` chain operator is supported.
+ `SUBTOTAL_RANGE`: Subtotal must be within the specified `subtotalRange` values.
+ `ITEM_QUANTITY_RANGE`: Quantity of items in scope must be within specified `itemQuantityRange` values.
+ `CUSTOM`: Custom trigger type defined in `customTrigger` object.

members.name: and
members.doc: Chain multiple triggers with the `and` operator.

members.name: or
members.doc: Chain multiple triggers with the `or` operator.

members.name: customTrigger
members.doc: Custom trigger.

members.name: subtotalRange
members.doc: Subtotal trigger range.

members.name: itemQuantityRange
members.doc: Item quantity trigger range.

docs.summary:
Set of key-value pairs.  
Extended field data. Each key corresponds to the namespace of the app that created the extended fields.
The value of each key is structured according to the schema defined when the extended fields were configured.

You can only access fields for which you have the appropriate permissions.

Learn more about [extended fields](https://dev.wix.com/docs/rest/articles/getting-started/extended-fields).

members.name: key:value
members.doc: `key` of type string, `value` of type struct

members.name: namespaces
members.doc:
Set of key-value pairs.  
Extended field data. Each key corresponds to the namespace of the app that created the extended fields.
The value of each key is structured according to the schema defined when the extended fields were configured.

You can only access fields for which you have the appropriate permissions.

Learn more about [extended fields](https://dev.wix.com/docs/rest/articles/getting-started/extended-fields).

members.name: id
members.doc: Discount rule ID.

members.name: revision
members.doc:
Revision number, which increments by 1 each time the discount rule is updated.
To prevent conflicting changes, the current `revision` must be passed when updating the discount rule.

members.name: createdDate
members.doc: Date and time the discount rule was created.

members.name: updatedDate
members.doc: Date and time the discount rule was last updated.

members.name: active
members.doc:
Whether the discount rule is active.

Default: `true`

members.name: name
members.doc: Discount rule name.

members.name: trigger
members.doc:
Discount rule trigger.
A set of conditions that must be met for the `discounts` to be applied.
Not passing a trigger will cause the discount to always apply.

members.name: activeTimeInfo
members.doc: Time frame in which the discount rule is active.

members.name: discounts
members.doc:
List of discounts that are applied when one or more triggers are met.

Currently, a discount rule can apply only 1 discount.

members.name: status
members.doc: Discount rule status.

members.name: usageCount
members.doc: Number of times the discount rule was used.

members.name: values
members.doc: Discounts.

members.name: start
members.doc: Date and time the discount rule is active **from**, in [ISO-8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Combined_date_and_time_representations) format.

members.name: end
members.doc: Date and time the discount rule is active **till**, in [ISO-8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Combined_date_and_time_representations) format.

members.name: targetType
members.doc:
Discount target.

+ `SPECIFIC_ITEMS`: Discount applies to a specific set of items.

members.name: specificItemsInfo
members.doc: Data related to `SPECIFIC_ITEMS` target type.

members.name: discountType
members.doc:
Discount type.

+ `PERCENTAGE`: Price is reduced by percentage value.
+ `FIXED_AMOUNT`: Price is reduced by fixed amount.
+ `FIXED_PRICE`: Price will be set to fixed amount.

members.name: percentage
members.doc: Percentage to discount from original price.

members.name: fixedAmount
members.doc: Amount to discount from original price.

members.name: fixedPrice
members.doc: Fixed price. Line item will be fixed to this price.

members.name: scopes
members.doc: All associated scopes for `SPECIFIC_ITEMS` target type.

docs.summary: The discount settings

members.name: appliesTo
members.doc: Discount applies to either `ALL_ITEMS`, or to the `LOWEST_PRICED_ITEM`.

members.name: includeSubscription
members.doc:
Whether the discount will apply to subscriptions.

Default: `false`

members.name: usageLimit
members.doc: Maximum total number of uses allowed for the discount rule.

members.name: usageLimitPerUser
members.doc:
The usage limit per user per discount.
 When not provided, this setting will not apply.

messages.name: _com_wix_ecom_discounts_BuyXGetYInfo
messages.displayName: Buy X Get Y Info Object

members.name: customerBuys
members.doc: Information about which items must be in the cart (buy X) for the discount to apply (get Y).

members.name: customerGets
members.doc: Information about which items will be discounted (get Y).

members.name: limit
members.doc:
The maximum number of times the 'buy X get Y' discount can be applied.
For example, when the value of `limit` is `2`, with a "2+1" sale on all items, the following logic applies:
+ Buy 2 get 1, buy 3 get 1.
+ Buy 4 get 2, buy 6 get 2, buy 9 get 2, and so on.

members.name: scopes
members.doc: Scopes of the items that must be added to the cart to enable the discount.

members.name: minimumQuantity
members.doc: Minimum number of items the customer must add to the cart to be eligible for a discount.

members.name: minimumSpend
members.doc: Minimum price the customer must add to the cart to be eligible for a discount.

members.name: quantity
members.doc:
Exact number of items in the cart that will be discounted.
 If the cart contains fewer items than the value of quantity, the discount will not apply.

members.name: scopes
members.doc: Scopes of the items that will be discounted.

messages.name: _com_wix_ecom_discounts_DiscountRuleUsageLimitReached
messages.displayName: Discount Rule Usage Limit Reached Object

members.name: rule
members.doc: Discount Rule

members.name: amount
members.doc: Amount.

members.name: convertedAmount
members.doc: Converted amount.

members.name: formattedAmount
members.doc: Amount formatted with currency symbol.

members.name: formattedConvertedAmount
members.doc: Converted amount formatted with currency symbol.

members.name: discountType
members.doc: Discount type.

members.name: lineItemIds
members.doc: IDs of line items the discount applies to, in GUID format.

members.name: appliedDiscountRule
members.doc: Applied discount rule.

members.name: id
members.doc: Applied discount rule ID.

members.name: name
members.doc: Discount rule name.

members.name: amount
members.doc: Total amount reduced from all discounted line items.

members.name: discountRuleType
members.doc: Discount rule type.

members.name: original
members.doc: Original discount rule name (in site's default language).

members.name: translated
members.doc:
Translated discount rule name according to buyer language.

 Default: `original`

docs.summary: Used for grouping line items. Sent when an item is added to a cart, checkout, or order.

members.name: catalogItemId
members.doc: ID of the item within the catalog it belongs to.

members.name: appId
members.doc:
ID of the app providing the catalog.

You can get your app's ID from its page in the [Wix Dev Center](https://dev.wix.com/apps).

For items from Wix catalogs, the following values always apply:
+ Wix Stores: `"215238eb-22a5-4c36-9e7b-e7c08025e04e"`
+ Wix Bookings: `"13d21c63-b5ec-5912-8397-c3a5ddb27a97"`
+ Wix Restaurants: `"9a5d83fd-8570-482e-81ab-cfa88942ee60"`

members.name: options
members.doc:
Additional item details in key:value pairs.

 Use this optional field to specify a variant of the item or add custom details. There are several ways to use `options`:
 + Pass specific information about the item variant in this field. For example, size and color of an item of clothing: `"options": {"Size": "M", "Color": "Red"}`.
 + Create a separate API for creating item variants that stores the details and generates a unique ID for each item variant. Then pass only the variant ID in this field. For example: `"options": {"variantId": "<VARIANT_ID>"}`.

members.name: id
members.doc: Line item ID.

members.name: quantity
members.doc: Line item quantity.

members.name: catalogReference
members.doc: Catalog and item reference info. Learn more about [integrating Wix Stores products with Wix eCommerce](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-stores/catalog/ecommerce-integration).

members.name: price
members.doc: Line item price.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Maximum number of items to return in the results.

members.name: cursor
members.doc:
Pointer to the next or previous page in the list of results.

Pass the relevant cursor token from the `pagingMetadata` object in the previous call's response.
Not relevant for the first request.

members.name: next
members.doc: Cursor string pointing to the next page in the list of results.

members.name: prev
members.doc: Cursor pointing to the previous page in the list of results.

members.name: count
members.doc: The number of items returned in this response.

members.name: offset
members.doc: The offset which was requested. Returned if offset paging was used.

members.name: total
members.doc: The total number of items that match the query. Returned if offset paging was used.

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Cursors to navigate through result pages. Returned if cursor paging was used.

members.name: fieldName
members.doc: Name of the field to sort by.

members.name: order
members.doc: Sort order.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

members.name: filter
members.doc: Filter object.

members.name: sort
members.doc: Sorting options. For example, `[{"fieldName":"sortField1"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","direction":"DESC"}]`.

members.name: paging
members.doc: Pointer to page of results using offset. Cannot be used together with `cursorPaging`.

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor pointing to page of results. Cannot be used together with `paging`. `cursorPaging.cursor` can not be used together with `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: paths
members.doc: The set of field mask paths.

members.name: currentEntityAsJson
members.doc:
Since platformized APIs only expose PATCH and not PUT we can't assume that the fields sent from the client are the actual diff.
 This means that to generate a list of changed fields (as opposed to sent fields) one needs to traverse both objects.
 We don't want to impose this on all developers and so we leave this traversal to the notification recipients which need it.

members.name: deletedEntityAsJson
members.doc: Entity that was deleted

members.name: id
members.doc:
Unique event ID.
 Allows clients to ignore duplicate webhooks.

members.name: entityFqdn
members.doc:
Assumes actions are also always typed to an entity_type
 Example: wix.stores.catalog.product, wix.bookings.session, wix.payments.transaction

members.name: slug
members.doc:
This is top level to ease client code dispatching of messages (switch on entity_fqdn+slug)
 This is although the created/updated/deleted notion is duplication of the oneof types
 Example: created/updated/deleted/started/completed/email_opened

members.name: entityId
members.doc: ID of the entity associated with the event.

members.name: eventTime
members.doc: Event timestamp.

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc:
Whether the event was triggered as a result of a privacy regulation application
 (for example, GDPR).

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

members.name: entityEventSequence
members.doc:
A sequence number defining the order of updates to the underlying entity.
 For example, given that some entity was updated at 16:00 and than again at 16:01,
  it is guaranteed that the sequence number of the second update is strictly higher than the first.
 As the consumer, you can use this value to ensure that you handle messages in the correct order.
 To do so, you will need to persist this number on your end, and compare the sequence number from the
  message against the one you have stored. Given that the stored number is higher, you should ignore the message.

members.name: discountRule
members.doc: Discount rule info.

members.name: discountRule
members.doc: Discount rule.

members.name: discountRuleId
members.doc: ID of the discount rule to retrieve.

members.name: discountRule
members.doc: The requested discount rule.

members.name: discountRule
members.doc: Discount rule info.

members.name: mask
members.doc: Explicit list of fields to update.

members.name: discountRule
members.doc: Updated discount rule.

members.name: discountRuleId
members.doc: ID of the discount rule to delete.

members.name: query
members.doc: Query options.

members.name: discountRules
members.doc: List of discount rules.

members.name: pagingMetadata
members.doc: Details on the paged set of results returned.

members.name: lineItems
members.doc: Line items for which to check for discount rules.

members.name: appliedDiscounts
members.doc: All eligible discounts.

docs.summary:
`NullValue` is a singleton enumeration to represent the null value for the `Value` type union. The JSON representation for `NullValue` is JSON `null`. Possible values are:
  • NULL_VALUE - Null value.

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED_SCOPE
  • CATALOG_ITEM - Specific catalog items
  • CUSTOM_FILTER - Specific items by custom filters

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED
  • AND - Chain multiple triggers with AND operator
  • SUBTOTAL_RANGE - Subtotal range trigger
  • ITEM_QUANTITY_RANGE - Item quantity range trigger
  • CUSTOM - Custom trigger, see Custom Triggers SPI for more details
  • OR - Chain multiple triggers with OR operator

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED - Rule status is not defined.
  • LIVE - Rule status is live.
  • EXPIRED - Rule status is expired, it might have been live in the past.
  • PENDING - Rule status is pending, it might be live in the future.

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED
  • PERCENTAGE - Percentage discount
  • FIXED_AMOUNT - Fixed amount discount
  • FIXED_PRICE - Fixed price discount

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED - Target type is not defined
  • SPECIFIC_ITEMS - Target type is a set of specific items
  • BUY_X_GET_Y - Target type is a buy x get y

TODO: check if can be removed Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED
  • ALL_ITEMS - Discount applies to all items at checkout.
  • LOWEST_PRICED_ITEM - Discount applies to the lowest priced item at checkout.

Possible values are:
  • ASC
  • DESC
